item.description:
Join us for a discussion about Robert Williams and his seminal text Negroes with Guns.  Although wildly popular and controversial during his time, Robert Williams is rarely discussed in today's history books. Still, his book and example of black self-determinism have served as huge influences upon various leftist organizations, including the Black Panther Party, in their fights against racism and tyranny.

We will be reading and discussing Robert Williams in honor of Black History Month.  Here is an article summarizing his time with the NAACP, the Deacons for Self Defence, his exile in Cuba and China, and his return to America: http://onlinejournal.com/artman/publish/article_509.shtml. Here is an excerpt from his book, Negroes with Guns chapters 3-5, which details his time in the NAACP, his battles with the KKK and racist cops in South Carolina, and the events leading up to the kidnapping charges for which he had to flee the US: http://nationalhumanitiescenter.org/pds/maai3/protest/text6/williamsnegroeswithguns.pdf

For further reading, pick up a copy of the complete book, Negroes with Guns at the Boston Public Library, or buy a copy online at www.alibris.com.
